questions: Choose the correct statement.
option1: Increasing pressure and increasing temperature can liquify a gas.
option2: Decreasing pressure and increasing temperature can liquify a gas
option3: Increasing pressure and decreasing temperature can liquify a gas.
option4: Decreasing pressure and decreasing temperature can liquify a gas.

questions: Choose the correct statement about boiling and evaporation.
option1: Evaporation results in lowering of the temperature.
option2: Boiling results in lowering the temperature.

questions: Clothes dry easily when exposed to sunlight. Which factor of evaporation is playing a major role here?
option1: Increase in surface area increases evaporation

questions: A gas can be compressed and stored in a small cylinder. The same amount of gas can also spread all over a room. What is the reason for this?
option1: Gas particles can change their volume to occupy the given space.
option2: Gas particles can reduce their size depending on the space available.
option3: Space between gas molecules changes easily.

questions: How does liquid propane transform into a gas when the stove is ignited?
option1: Temperature increases which changes liquid LPG to gas
option2: Temperature decreases which changes liquid LPG to gas
option3: Pressure increases which changes liquid LPG to gas
option4: Pressure decreases which changes liquid LPG to gas

questions: Why do the gas particles exert pressure on the walls of the container in all directions?
option1: Gas particles are attracted to the walls of the container
option2: Gas particles, due to high K.E, collide randomly with each other and container walls.
option3: Gas particles want to stick to walls of the container
option4: Forces of attraction are more near the walls of the container
